intro: Diapedium stoloniferum, commonly known as the stoloniferous diapedium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its creeping growth habit, with stolons that root at the nodes to form new plants. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
